Package org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.fsa

Class InputSimulator

java.lang.Object
org.svvrl.goal.core.AbstractEditable
org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.fsa.InputSimulator
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.EventListener, Editable
public class InputSimulator
extends AbstractEditable
An InputSimulator takes an automaton and an input word as its inputs and computes all runs of the automaton on the input word incrementally. Each run is represented as a sequence of configurations. A configuration is composed of a state and a suffix of the word.
Author:
Ming-Hsien Tsai
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • InputSimulator

      public InputSimulator​(FSA aut, InputSequence seq)
      Constructor with an automaton and an input sequence for the input simulation.
      Parameters:
      aut - a finite state automaton with an acceptance condition on states
      seq - an input sequence

  • Method Details

    • getAutomaton

      public FSA getAutomaton()
      Returns the automaton that this simulator is testing words on.

    • setFrozen

      public void setFrozen​(InputSimulator.Run cr, boolean b)
      Freezes a configuration run or thaws it.
      Parameters:
      cr - a configuration run
      b - true to freeze the configuration run or false to thaw it

    • isFrozen

      public boolean isFrozen​(InputSimulator.Run cr)
      Returns true if a configuration run is frozen.
      Parameters:
      cr - a configuration run
      Returns:
      true if a configuration run is frozen

    • stepForward

      public void stepForward()
      Consumes one symbol for the last configurations in all runs computed so far. A successive configuration will be inserted to the end of the corresponding run.

    • stepBackward

      public void stepBackward()
      Makes all runs go one step backward except the frozen runs.

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets this simulator.
